intro: Blennosperma, commonly known as the desert milkweed, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. They are characterized by their erect or spreading growth habit and often have hairy stems and leaves. The flowers are typically yellow or orange and are arranged in composite heads, typical of the Asteraceae family. Blennosperma species are adapted to withstand drought conditions, making them resilient in harsh environments.
